sense.name: the ending
sense.commentary: STOP[+event] halt, stoppage - the event o something ending
sense.examples: It came to a stop at the bottom of the hill. You must come to a complete stop at the end of the street. The third baseman made some remarkable stops. His stoppage of the flow resulted in a flood. The first good stop of the game was in the third quarter at 4:27pm.

sense.name: a visit
sense.commentary: STOP[+event] stopover, layover - a brief stay in the course of a journey
sense.examples: That stop lasted over an hour. This flight was cheaper because of the three hour stop in Chicago. They made a stopver to visit friends. His next stop is Atlanta. I'm getting off of the train at the next stop. Our next stop will not be for two hours so use the toilets now.

sense.name: state of inactivity
sense.commentary: STOP[+event] arrest, heck, halt, hitch, stay, stoppage - the state of inactivity following an interruption
sense.examples: During the fifth stop he got some lunch. The momentary stop enabled him to escape. He spent the entire stop in his seat.

sense.name: motion stopper
sense.commentary: catch - a restraint that checks the motion of something
sense.examples: George put a stop over the drain to give Fido a bath. He used a book as a stop to hold the door open.

sense.name: pipe blockage
sense.commentary: blockage, block, closure, occlusion, stoppage - an obstruction in a pipe or tube
sense.examples: After John left, Mary spent an hour clearing the stop in the toilet. We had to call a plumber to clear out the stop in the drainpipe.

sense.name: phonetic sound
sense.commentary: stop consonant, occlusive, plosive consonant, plosive speech sound, plosive - a consonant produced by stopping the flow of air at some point and suddenly releasing it
sense.examples: His stop consonants are too aspirated. She found it difficult to palatal stops with her new retainer.

sense.name: punctuation
sense.commentary: period, point, full stop, full point - a punctuation mark (.) placed at the end of a declarative sentence to indicate a full stop or after abbreviations
sense.examples: In England they call a period a stop. The stop at the end of the third sentence is missing.

sense.name: camera piece
sense.commentary: diaphragm a mechanical divide in a camera that control size of aperture of the lens
sense.examples: The new cameras adjust the stop automatically.

sense.name: knob
sense.commentary: (music) a knob on an organ that is pulled to change the sound quality from the organ pipes
sense.examples: The organist pulled out all the stops.
